Videogame.title: Masks and Marquises, a Palau Moja's Story
Videogame.client: Giravolt Crea Lab Innovation Lab, formed by CITM-UPC and the Catalan Agency for Cultural Heritage through its Giravolt program.
Videogame.description: Design and development of a multiplayer VR game for Oculus Quest 3 set in the Baroque-era Palau Moja.
Videogame.overview: In a team of 8 members, we designed and developed a multiplayer virtual reality video game for Oculus Quest 3 in just 4 months. The project was part of Giravolt Crea Lab, an innovation initiative by CITM-UPC and the Catalan Agency for Cultural Heritage through its Giravolt program. The game is set in the Palau Moja during the Baroque era. On Carnival Day, a masquerade ball is underway when the host, Antonio López—a wealthy man with many secrets—is suddenly found dead in the middle of the room. Players, who are secretly involved in fraudulent schemes, must destroy the evidence and avoid being eliminated by an infiltrator.
Videogame.role: I was in charge of the HUD design and the visual identity of the game, including logo, colors and branding. I also created and textured 3D models, and collaborated in the overall game design, contributing to the mechanics and user experience.
Videogame.software: Unity, Adobe Substance, Maya, Adobe Photoshop, Figma

Videogame.title: Kitchen Hunt
Videogame.overview: Kitchen Hunt is a 3D single-player game where the player takes on the role of Klauss, a young man overwhelmed by the pressure of inheriting the family kitchen business. Under his father Jeff’s ultimatum, Klauss must complete increasingly complex tasks in the kitchen. As his anxiety grows, the world around him distorts — reflecting his emotional state.
Videogame.role: As the artist of the team, my responsabilities focused on: Character design in Figma and Illustrator, 3D modeling of characters and kitchen environment in Maya, Texturing using Adobe Substance Painter and Photoshop and Integration of assets and materials into Unity
Videogame.description: Design and creation of a 3D computer videogame with Unity.
Videogame.fields: Visual Identity, Character Design, 3D Modeling, 3D Model Texturing, Game Design
Videogame.software: Unity, Adobe Substance, Maya, Adobe Photoshop, Figma

Videogame.title: Magic Room
Videogame.description: Design and creation of a virtual reality video game for Oculus Quest with Unity.
Videogame.overview: MagicRoom is a virtual reality escape room developed in Unity, where players interact using natural hand gestures instead of traditional controllers. The project uses Unity’s XR Hands and XR Interaction Toolkit, allowing full compatibility with both hand tracking and controllers through the XR Interaction Manager. Custom gestures were implemented to activate spells and solve puzzles in a magical dungeon setting.
Videogame.role: My role focused on the design and integration of the user interface (UI), ensuring it was intuitive and immersive within a gesture-based environment. This included adapting interaction cues and visual feedback to work seamlessly with both hand tracking and controller input.
Videogame.software: Unity, Adobe Substance, Maya, Adobe Photoshop, Figma

Videogame.title: Barcimed
Videogame.overview: An interactive web app designed to guide users through a historical route in the city of Barcelona. By observing their surroundings and solving contextual riddles, users can unlock immersive 360° videos and collect educational content in the form of knowledge cards. The experience blends narrative, geolocation, and gamification to foster historical curiosity among young audiences.
Videogame.description: Creation an immersive experience to discover the Medieval Barcelona
Videogame.role: This project was my final degree project, currently under evaluation for a Distinction (Honors). It was highly praised for its complexity, originality, and the integration of multiple disciplines. My work spanned the entire creative and technical pipeline: from developing a Game Design Document (GDD) and writing a literary script, to producing 360° video content in Unity, designing and illustrating assets with Figma and Illustrator, 3D modeling in Maya, texturing with Adobe Substance Painter, and programming a web app using React.
Videogame.fields: Ux and UI Design, React, Postproduction, 360
Videogame.software: Visual Studio Code, Figma, Unity, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Maya, Adobe Substance

Visual identity.overview: This is a real-world branding project I developed for Farmacia Isabel Tell, located next to the Hospital de Sant Pau. I designed a logotype inspired by the principles of Modernisme, taking visual reference from the building’s stained glass windows. The concept also reflects nature and the essential identity of the pharmacy team. Postproduction.title: Diwine Liberation
Postproduction.description: Diwine Liberation is a video mapping project created during the VII Workshop Empúries at the MAC Empúries.
Postproduction.overview:
Diwine Liberation is a video mapping project created during the VII Workshop Empúries at the MAC Empúries, in collaboration with Mònica González, Anna Cuello, Adelina Mateoiu and Simina Haiduc.

The piece immerses viewers in an unforgettable night of celebration, mystery and liberation, seen through the eyes of Dionysos, the god who embodies the essence of wine.

Inspired by ancient legends, the animation follows Dionysos on his return to Empúries, where he encounters the Ménades and their enchanting rituals.

Wine, as the central element, becomes the elixir of life, a symbol of freedom and expression for women, and a drink that unleashes inner desires in men.

The project was conceived, designed and animated in just one day, blending mythology, symbolism and visual rhythm in a collective artistic expression.
